abstract: The chip maker, which had already signaled its intention to return to the stock markets, has hired five banks to advise on a forthcoming initial public offering.
snippet: The chip maker, which had already signaled its intention to return to the stock markets, has hired five banks to advise on a forthcoming initial public offering.
lead_paragraph: Freescale Semiconductor, the chip maker acquired by several buyout firms in 2006 for $17.6 billion, has hired a bevy of investment banks to underwrite an initial public offering, people briefed on the matter told DealBook on Wednesday.

headline.main: Freescale Hires Advisers for an I.P.O.

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
